questions.statement: Which of these is necessary condition for automatic type conversion in Java?
options: The destination type is smaller than source type
The destination type is larger than source type
The destination type can be larger or smaller than source type
correctAns: The destination type is larger than source type

questions.statement: What is the prototype of the default constructor of this class?
What is the error in this code?
options: b can not contain value 100, limited by its range.
* operator has converted b * 50 into int, which can not be converted to byte without casting.
correctAns: * operator has converted b * 50 into int, which can not be converted to byte without casting.
questions.explain: While evaluating an expression containing int, bytes or shorts , the whole expression is converted to int then evaluated and result is also of type int.

questions.statement: If an expression contains double, int, float, long, then whole expression will promoted into which of these data types?
questions.explain: If any operand is double the result of expression is double.

options: Floating-point value assigned to an integer type
Integer value assigned to floating type
Floating-point value assigned to an Floating type
Integer value assigned to floating type
correctAns: Floating-point value assigned to an integer type

questions.statement: What is the output of this program?
questions.explain: Operator ++ increments the value of character by 1. c1 and c2 are given values D and 84, when we use ++ operator their values increments by 1, c1 and c2 becomes E and U respectively.

questions.statement: What is the output of this program?
questions.explain: Type casting a larger variable into a smaller variable results in modulo of larger variable by range of smaller variable. b contains 300 which is larger than byte’s range i:e -128 to 127 hence d contains 300 modulo 256 i:e 44.

questions.statement: What is the output of this program?
options: An exception is thrown at runtime.
questions.explain: The code does not compile because the method calculate() in class A is final and so cannot be overridden by method of class b.

questions.statement: What is the output of this program, if we run as “java main_arguments 1 2 3”?
questions.explain: In argument[0] = args;, the reference variable arg[0], which was referring to an array with two elements, is reassigned to an array (args) with three elements.

questions.statement: What is the output of this program?
questions.explain: A runtime error will occur owning to the main method of the code fragment not being declared static.
